result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joseph Isaiah Mathis

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Joseph Isaiah Mathis not in court, in custody.  Attorney Haley E Wentz appeared by video for Joseph Isaiah Mathis.  Attorney Kelly O'Neill appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for bail/bond hearing.
Court informed the parties of the information he received regarding mental health program options at the Behavioral Health Division. 
Court ordered case adjourned to allow defense counsel to discuss available options AT BHD with defendant.
This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.
Status conference scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Court orders defendant TO JUSTICE POINT for supervision Level 5.

Defendant Joseph Isaiah Mathis appeared by video. Attorney Haley E Wentz appeared as a friend of the court by video for Joseph Isaiah Mathis.  Prosecuting attorney Kelly O'Neill in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  
Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION. 
Court informed parties that he will be contacting the Behavioral Health Division.
Court ordered case adjourned for bail/bond hearing in Branch 30.
This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.
Bail/bond hearing scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 10:30 am.
